page.title: 01Historic Buildings
page.content:
Eltham Church The church of St John the Baptist, stands at the corner of Well Hall road and Eltham Hill on a site which has been occupied by a church since the mid twelfth century. The first Australian aborigine to have visited England is buried in its graveyard
Avery Hill The Avery Hill estate was laid out in the 1880's by Colonel North. It was Purchased by the LCC in 1902 and now much of it is open to the public. The mansion and Winter gardens now form the nucleus of the Avery Hill College of Education although much of the house was destroyed in World War 2. The 3 original glasshouses still remain.
